authorities.invalid_url_body: The URL you entered was invalid, please try again

export.start_title: Share your location history anonymously with your community if you have tested positive for COVID-19.
export.start_body: The representative from your Healthcare Authority will walk you through this process during your interview.
export.code_input_body: The representative from {{name}} will provide a verification code over the phone to link your data with {{name}}.
export.consent_button_subtitle: By proceeding, you agree that your Heathcare Authority can retain your data for a period of time.
export.location_consent_body:
Your location history is used by representatives of {{name}} to interview you about places you visited and when you were there.

Once you send your location history to {{name}}, they will retain your data for a specific period of time. Please view their privacy policy here.
export.publish_consent_body:
During the interview with {{name}} your interviewer can remove private locations, such as homes and apartments. They can also add any additional places you believe should be included.

{{name}} may share the GPS coordinates from your location history, including date, time, and duration of your visits to let others in your community know if they may have crossed paths with the virus.

I understand that the {{name}} representative will ask me verbally at the end of the interview if I consent.
export.confirm_upload_title: Send your location history to your HA
export.confirm_upload_body:
This will help in contact tracing efforts.

If you choose not to send your Location History to {{name}}, you are choosing to opt out of contact tracing efforts that help keep your community safe.
export.complete_title: Thanks for keeping your community safe!
export.complete_body: By sharing your health status and location history anonymously with your community, you’re being proactive about fighting the spread of COVID-19.
export.exit_warning_body: You will need to restart this process

history.possible_exposure_para: It is possible you were in contact with or close to someone who tested positive for COVID-19
history.what_does_this_mean_para_bluetooth:
Based on your contact tracing history, it is possible that you may have been in contact with or close to somebody who was diagnosed with COVID-19. This does not mean you are infected but that you might be.

For further information on what you should do you can refer to the Mayo Clinic’s website.
history.what_does_this_mean_para_location:
Based on your GPS history, it is possible that you may have been in contact with or close to somebody who was diagnosed with COVID-19. This does not mean you are infected but that you might be.

For further information on what you should do you can refer to the Mayo Clinic’s website.
history.what_if_no_symptoms: What if I’m not showing symptoms?
history.what_if_no_symptoms_para:
If you have no symptoms but still would like to be tested you can go to your nearest testing site.

Individuals who don't exhibit symptoms can sometimes still carry the infection and infect others. Being careful about social distancing and coming in contact with large groups or at risk individuals (the elderly, those with significant other medical issues) is important to manage both your risk and the risk to others.

import.error: Something went wrong while importing your data.

google.already_imported: Provided Takeout file has already been imported.
google.disclaimer: Safe Paths has no affiliation with Google and never shares your data.
google.file_open_error:
Could not open the file. 
Please, make sure the file is opened from Google Drive
google.instructions_detailed:
Visit Google Takeout and export your Location History using the following settings: 
1. Delivery method: "Add to Drive" 
2. Frequency: "Export once" 
3. File type & size: ".zip" and "1GB"
4. Google sends an email when the export is ready 
5. Return here to import locations from Google Drive
google.instructions_first: Adding location data from Google will give you a head start on building your recent locations.
google.instructions_second: Before you can import, you must first "Take out" your location data from Google.
google.invalid_file_format:
Provided file format is not supported. 
Supported formats: ".zip".
google.no_recent_locations: Takeout doesn't have any recent locations.
google.title: Google Maps

import.subtitle: To see if you encountered someone with COVID-19 prior to downloading this app, you can import your personal location history.
import.success: Recent locations has been successfully imported!
import.title: Import Locations

label.about_para:
PathCheck is a global movement to develop free, open-source, privacy-by-design tools for residents, public health officials, and larger communities to flatten the curve of COVID-19, reduce fear, and prevent a surveillance-state response to the pandemic. 

For more information, visit
label.authorities_desc:
Select one or more Healthcare Authorities in your area for information about COVID-19 near you, if available. 

Either select a name from the global registry or enter a web address provided by a Healthcare Authority that has implemented PathCheck.
label.authorities_new_in_area_msg: Subscribe to {{count}} new trusted Healthcare Authority in your location
label.authorities_new_in_area_msg_plural: Subscribe to {{count}} new trusted Healthcare Authorities in your location
label.authorities_new_subscription_msg: You have been subscribed to {{count}} new authority in your location
label.authorities_new_subscription_msg_plural: You have been subscribed to {{count}} new authorities in your location
label.authorities_removal_alert_desc: Are you sure you want to remove this authority data source?
label.choose_provider_subtitle: Select a Healthcare Authority to learn about COVID-19 in your area, where available
label.event_history_subtitle: Understand your personal exposure based on information shared by health authorities.
label.home_at_risk_subsubtext: This does not mean you are infected.
label.home_at_risk_subtext_bluetooth: Based on your contact tracing history, it is possible you were in contact with or close to someone diagnosed with COVID-19.
label.home_at_risk_subtext_location: Based on your GPS history, it is possible you were in contact with or close to someone diagnosed with COVID-19.
label.home_no_contact_subtext: Based on available data you haven’t been near anyone reported positive for COVID-19.
label.home_not_available_header_bluetooth: Exposure history notifications are not yet available
label.home_not_available_subtext_bluetooth: Your phone is not currently covered by Healthcare Authorities using PathCheck.
label.home_setting_off_subtext_bluetooth: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable contact tracing in the settings screen.
label.home_setting_off_subtext_location: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable location history in the settings screen.
label.home_unknown_subtext_bluetooth: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable contact tracing on the app.
label.home_unknown_subtext_location: We can’t tell if you’re at risk unless you enable the app to access your location.
label.launch_authority_header: Healthcare Authorities will provide your device with the local data to know if you have crossed paths with an infected person
label.launch_authority_subheader: Automatically subscribe to receive the latest updates from Healthcare Authorities in your area.
label.launch_done_subheader: You’re ready to roll. Remember, you can always update your preferences later.
label.launch_exposure_notif_subheader:
To be notified about updates to your exposure history, your phone needs permission to exchange anonymous Bluetooth random ID with other devices.

Exposure Notifcations only work with other devices with the setting enabled.

You can turn off this notifications at any time.
label.launch_header_bluetooth: To know who you have been in contact with, your phone needs to access your Bluetooth.
label.launch_header_location: To remember where you go, your phone needs to save your location.
label.launch_notif_header: Notifications will let you know if you cross paths with an infected person.
label.launch_notif_subheader: We won't bother you except to share updates on your potential exposure risks.
label.launch_screen1_header: The way back to normal starts here.
label.launch_screen2_header_bluetooth: Your phone remembers other devices it meets but won't identify you to other people.
label.launch_screen2_header_location: Get notified if you cross paths with someone later diagnosed for COVID-19.
label.launch_screen2_subheader_bluetooth:
Nearby phones use Bluetooth to share and save random number strings to recall devices nearby.

If a person reports a positive diagnosis, their phone's recent random IDs are flagged to anonymously notify others. No locations or personal info is shared.
label.launch_screen3_header_bluetooth: Receive notifications when someone you encountered later chooses to report a positive diagnosis.
label.launch_screen3_header_location: If you test positive, you can choose to donate your data anonymously
label.launch_screen3_subheader_bluetooth: Learn details about the encounter, such as the date, duration, and Bluetooth signal strength.
label.launch_screen3_subheader_location: Which helps keep your entire community safe.
label.launch_screen4_header_bluetooth: If you test positive for the virus that causes COVID-19, you can choose to share your diagnosis anonymously.
label.launch_screen4_header_location: You're in complete control. Data is only saved on your phone.
label.launch_screen4_subheader_bluetooth: This helps others in your community contain the spread of the virus.
label.launch_screen4_subheader_location: If you test positive, you alone can choose whether to share.
label.launch_subheader: Don’t worry, information never leaves your device unless you explicitly decide to share.
label.legal_page_address:
PathCheck
58 Day Street
Box 441621
Somerville, MA 02144
label.location_disabled_message: COVID Safe Paths requires location services.
label.location_enabled_message: COVID Safe Paths is securely storing your GPS coordinates once every five minutes on this device.
label.news_subtitle: Find the latest updates from Safe Paths and your local Healthcare Authorities, where available
label.push_at_risk_message: You have crossed paths with a COVID-19 patient
label.team_para: Our team is composed of a consortium of epidemiologists, engineers, data scientists, digital privacy evangelists, professors and researchers from reputable institutions, including: MIT, Harvard, The Mayo Clinic, TripleBlind, EyeNetra, Ernst & Young and Link Ventures.

onboarding.eula_message: *You must accept in order to use Safe Paths

share.paragraph_first: If you test positive for COVID-19, please do your part by sharing your location history with local authorities.
share.paragraph_second: Location is shared as a simple list of times and places, no additional information.
share.subtitle: Your private data can be transferred to health authorities, backed up, or otherwise shared.
share.title: Share location history
